title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments: Currently watching Succession. Loving Tom Greg duo.

Dude i am also watching succession bingwatched 
2 seasons at 3rd season now
Season 2 of Rocket Boys is out. Inspiring stuff, but not sure how much is true and how much is deliberately fiction.
Well it's on Hotstar for now but will be removed after March 31st.
Shrinking on Apple TV+ is an amazing sitcom and it’s about a line of a therapist.
Would highly recommend the last of us
discovered arjun rampal film " daddy" on amazon prime .. its a must watch.. its not a typical bollywood gangster film.. very dark and non commercial.. do check this out
Did anybody see family man , it's friggin fantastic
Post show , Was thinking of how can Congress be so stupid to give away the nationalistic tag
Watched Rockstar by imtiaz ali for first time and i lovedd it
The last episode was kinda meh but overall liked it

Just completed Wednesday. Great show with Harry Potter vibes.

And You season 4. Good season with that Rhys Montrose twist. Miss Love Quinn from season 3.
Finished watching Upright. Great series. Highly recommended
